Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Establishing National Standards for and Regulating International and Interprovincial Trade in Maple Products

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Maple Products Regulations.
In these Regulations,

Definition.Text: Act means the Canada Agricultural Products Act; (Loi)
Agency means the Canadian Food Inspection Agency established by section 3 of the Canadian Food Inspection Agency Act; (Agence)
colour class means a colour class referred to in paragraph 5(1)(f); (classe de couleur)
communicable disease means a disease capable of being transmitted through food or likely to contaminate food or food contact surfaces with microorganisms; (maladie transmissible)

contaminated, in respect of a maple product, means containing a chemical, drug, food additive, heavy metal, industrial pollutant, ingredient, medicament, microbe, pesticide, poison, toxin or any other substance not permitted by, or in an amount in excess of limits prescribed under, the Canadian Environmental Protection Act, 1999, the Food and Drugs Act or the Pest Control Products Act; (contaminé)
Director means the Director designated by the President of the Agency; (directeur)
edible means fit for use as human food; (version anglaise seulement)
first dealer means any person who acquires for sale under their own label maple products packed by another person; (premier commerçant)
food has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Food and Drugs Act; (aliment)
food additive has the same meaning as in section B.01.001 of Part B of the Food and Drug Regulations; (additif alimentaire)
light transmission means the ability of maple syrup to transmit light as determined in accordance with Schedule III; (transmission de lumière)
maple product means any product obtained exclusively by the concentration of maple sap or maple syrup, excluding any substitute; (produit de l’érable)
maple sap means the sap obtained exclusively from trees of the botanical genus Acer; (sève d’érable)
maple syrup means the syrup obtained exclusively by the concentration of maple sap or by the dilution or solution of a maple product, other than maple sap, in potable water; (sirop d’érable)

maple syrup shipper establishment means the establishment of a person who buys maple syrup that is packed in bulk containers for colour classification, preparation and resale in bulk and who exports the syrup or conveys it from one province to another; (établissement d’un expéditeur de sirop d’érable)
operator means the person who is responsible for the operation of a registered establishment; (exploitant)

packing establishment means an establishment in which the preparation of maple products, including colour classification, takes place, but does not include a sugar bush establishment or a maple syrup shipper establishment; (établissement d’emballage)
panel means principal display panel; (espace)
principal display panel and principal display surface have the same meanings as in the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations; (espace principal and principale surface exposée)
registered establishment means an establishment that is registered in accordance with section 6.1; (établissement agréé)
registration number means the number assigned to a registered establishment under section 6.1; (numéro d’agrément)
substitute means any product that resembles a maple product in appearance and is prepared for the same uses as a maple product but is not obtained exclusively from maple sap; (succédané)
sugar bush establishment means an establishment in which the preparation of maple products directly from maple sap, including colour classification, takes place. (établissement d’une érablière)

Section.Text: These Regulations apply to maple products including maple syrup, maple sugar, soft maple sugar, maple butter and maple taffy.

No person shall market a product in import, export or interprovincial trade in such a manner that it is likely to be mistaken for a maple product for which a grade or standard is established under these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), no person shall market a maple product in import, export or interprovincial trade as food unless the maple product

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is not contaminated;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is edible;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is prepared in a sanitary manner; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: meets all other requirements of the Food and Drugs Act and the Food and Drug Regulations.

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited for anyone to mix a maple product that is contaminated with another maple product so that it meets the requirements of subsection (1).

Section.Text: Despite section 3.2, a maple product that is contaminated may be marketed in import, export or interprovincial trade as animal food if it is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: fit for use as animal food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: labelled with the words “animal food” and “aliments pour animaux”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prepared separately from maple products intended for use as food; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: where appropriate, treated to give it the appearance of being inedible.

Section.Text: The grade names “Canada Grade A” and “Canada Processing Grade” are prescribed for Canadian maple syrup and may be used only if the maple syrup meets the requirements set out in Schedule I.

The grade names “Grade A” and “Processing Grade” are prescribed for imported maple syrup and may be used only if the imported maple syrup meets the applicable requirements for the equivalent maple syrup “Canada Grade A” and “Canada Processing Grade”, respectively.

Subsection.Text: The grade names set out in section 4 for Canadian maple syrup may be used for any imported maple syrup that has been prepared in a registered establishment other than a sugar bush establishment.
For greater certainty, this provision does not limit the application of section 19.
Maple syrup may be graded only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is produced exclusively by the concentration of maple sap or by the dilution or solution of a maple product, other than maple sap, in potable water;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is clean, wholesome and fit for human consumption;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: it has a minimum soluble solids content of 66 per cent and has a maximum soluble solids content of 68.9 per cent as determined by a refractometer or hydrometer at 20°C; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of maple syrup that is graded as “Canada Grade A”, its colour class has been determined in accordance with Schedule III.

Subsection.Text: Maple syrup shall be graded in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a registered establishment; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any place, where it is graded by or on behalf of the operator of a registered maple syrup shipper establishment.

Section.Text: Maple syrup may be graded by a grader or the operator. It may also be graded by a person designated by the operator or an employee of a registered establishment under the supervision of a grader or the operator.

Subsection.Text: An application for the registration of a sugar bush establishment, a packing establishment or a maple syrup shipper establishment, or for the renewal or the amendment of an existing registration, shall be made to the Director in a form provided by the Agency, accompanied by the applicable fee prescribed by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency Fees Notice, and shall contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address, including the postal code, telephone number and, if any, facsimile number and electronic mail address of the applicant and of the establishment, where they are different from those of the applicant;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whether it is an application for a new registration or for a renewal or an amendment of an existing registration;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the existing registration number, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: whether the establishment is owned by an individual, a partnership, a co-operative or a corporation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name under which the establishment operates, where the name is different from that of the applicant;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the names and titles of all owners, partners, officers and directors of the establishment; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: whether the establishment is a sugar bush establishment, a packing establishment or a maple syrup shipper establishment.

Subsection.Text: An application referred to in subsection (1) shall have annexed thereto an outline of a sanitation program for the establishment, indicating

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person responsible for carrying out the program;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the equipment and chemical agents available for use to bring about and maintain clean and sanitary conditions; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the measures proposed to be taken to ensure clean and sanitary conditions.

Subsection.Text: Where an application referred to in subsection 6(1) is made, the establishment shall be registered if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person who is responsible for the operation of the establishment demonstrates to an inspector that he understands the colour-classification and grading requirements of these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person who is responsible for the operation of the establishment has at his disposal the equipment necessary to determine the colour and soluble-solids content of maple syrup; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the establishment meets the requirements of these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Where the conditions set out in subsection (1) are met, the Director shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: register the establishment by entering the name of the establishment in the register of registered establishments of the Agency and by assigning a registration number to the establishment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: issue to the operator of the establishment a certificate of registration.

Subsection.Text: Subject to sections 6.3 and 6.4, a certificate of registration shall remain in force for a period of 12 months following the date of issuance.

The operator shall post and keep posted the certificate of registration issued to the operator under section 6.1 in a conspicuous place in the registered establishment for the period during which the certificate remains in force.
A certificate of registration is not assignable or transferable.
The Director may suspend the registration of a registered establishment

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the establishment does not meet the requirements of the Act or these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the operator does not comply with the provisions of the Act or these Regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is reasonable to believe that public health will be endangered if the establishment is allowed to continue operating; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the operator has failed or is unable to take immediate corrective measures to remedy any situation referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: No registration shall be suspended under subsection (1) unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an inspector has, at the time of an inspection, notified the operator of the existence of grounds for suspension under paragraph (1)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an inspector has provided the operator with a copy of an inspection report prepared by the inspector that sets out the grounds for suspension, the required corrective measures and the dates by which those measures must be implemented in order to avoid suspension and cancellation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of suspension of registration is delivered to the operator.

Subsection.Text: A suspension of registration under subsection (1) shall remain in effect

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: until the required corrective measures have been taken and have been verified by an inspector; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where a cancellation procedure has been commenced under section 6.4, until resolution of the cancellation issuer.

Subsection.Text: The Director may cancel the registration of a registered establishment where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the operator has not implemented the required corrective measures within the 30-day period following the day on which the registration was suspended or within any longer period of time allowed under subsection (1.1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: there is a change in ownership that involves a change of management of the establishment; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the application for registration contains false or misleading information.

Subsection.Text: If it is not possible for the operator to implement the required corrective measures within 30 days, the Director shall, on the request of the operator, allow the operator a longer period of time that is adequate to implement those measures.
No registration shall be cancelled under subsection (1) unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the operator was advised of an opportunity to be heard in respect of the cancellation and was given that opportunity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of cancellation of registration was delivered to the operator.

Section.Text: Where the registration of an establishment has been suspended or cancelled, the operator of the establishment shall immediately surrender the certificate of registration to an inspector.

Subsection.Text: In every packing plant

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the land and buildings comprising the plant,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the lavatories, dressing rooms and washrooms in the plant, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: all containers used in the plant

Subsection.Text: Every packing plant shall be so designed and constructed that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: no odours or fumes from any lavatory, sink or cesspool will pervade any room or area in which maple products are prepared, packed or stored; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no maple product will come in contact with anything in the plant that might injuriously affect its quality.

Subsection.Text: No person who is suffering from a communicable disease, is a known carrier of a communicable disease or has an infected wound or open lesion shall work in any area of a packing plant where there is a danger of contaminating maple products or maple product contact surfaces with micro-organisms of public health significance.

Every person engaged in handling or processing maple products shall maintain a high degree of personal cleanliness while on duty and wear and keep clean appropriate clothing including suitable hair covering in order to prevent contamination of maple products.
No person shall smoke or chew tobacco in any part of a packing plant in which maple products are prepared.
All equipment used in the operations of a sugar bush operator who prepares and grades maple products shall be clean and sanitary.

Section.Text: All maple products that are prepared or graded in a packing plant shall be prepared, packed and stored in a sanitary manner.
Maple syrup shall be packed as required by this Part as a condition to application or use of a grade name in respect of that syrup.

Subsection.Text: Every container that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: marked with a grade name, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shipped outside the province in which it was produced

Subsection.Text: Every container

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: of maple syrup that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has a capacity of five litres or less, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is marked with a grade name, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: of maple sugar that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has a capacity of five kilograms or less, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is exported out of Canada or sent or conveyed from one province to another

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, the net quantity of maple syrup in a container shall be determined by the method described in Schedule V.
Every container of maple syrup marked with a grade name or every container of maple sugar shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be filled to at least 90 per cent of its capacity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contain at least the net quantity of maple syrup or maple sugar that is marked on its label.

Subsection.Text: Every container of maple syrup shall be capable of being securely closed by means of a screw-cap, friction lid or hermetically sealed lid, bung or similar device.

Section.Text: Maple syrup shall be marked as required by this Part as a condition to the application or use of a grade name in respect of that syrup.

Subsection.Text: Every container of maple syrup that is graded under these Regulations shall bear a label marked

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with the words “maple syrup”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with the grade name on the same panel as the name of the product and in letters of a size set out in Schedule IV;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of maple syrup that is “Canada Grade A”, with the name of the colour class in English and French;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: with the net quantity expressed in litres or, if less than one litre, in millilitres;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the sugar bush establishment, the packing establishment or the maple syrup shipper establishment, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the first dealer and the registration number of the packing establishment; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: with the lot number or the production code.

Subsection.Text: Where the area of the principal display surface of a label is that set out in Column I of an item of Schedule IV, letters with the minimum height set out in Column II of the item shall be used.
Every container of a maple product, other than maple syrup, that is shipped in interprovincial or international trade shall bear a label marked

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with the name of the contents;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with the net quantity expressed in kilograms or, if less than one kilogram, in grams; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the sugar bush establishment or the packing establishment, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the first dealer and the registration number of the packing establishment.

Subsection.Text: A person who wishes to have maple products inspected or graded shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: make a request to an inspector at least 24 hours before the service is required or, if there is no inspector in the area, at the nearest inspection office at least 48 hours before the service is required;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: present the maple products at a place and time designated by an inspector;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: make all maple products from which samples will be drawn by the inspector readily accessible and ensure that they are in a condition suitable for inspection or grading;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: be available to assist the inspector, or designate an employee on the premises who will be available to assist the inspector, to open and close the containers and provide such other assistance as the inspector may request in order to provide the service;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: indicate the grade names and colour class, if any, proposed to be placed on the containers, where the maple products are unlabelled at the time they are presented;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: indicate whether a certificate of inspection will be required; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: pay the applicable fee prescribed by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency Fees Notice, in accordance with the conditions of payment set out in that Notice.

Subsection.Text: An inspector shall, on the written request of a person who has a financial interest in maple products that were inspected or graded under these Regulations, provide the person with a copy of the certificate of inspection.

Subject to subsection (3), the Director must, on application by a person who has a financial interest in maple products in respect of which a certificate of inspection or an export certificate has been issued under section 13, grant an appeal inspection of those products.
The application for an appeal inspection shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: set out the reasons for requesting the appeal inspection; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be accompanied by a copy of the original certificate.

Subsection.Text: The Director may refuse to grant an appeal inspection where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the maple products cannot be made accessible for inspection;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the maple products cannot be identified by the original certificate or the vehicle, if any, in which they were conveyed;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: less than 75 per cent of the lot of maple products is available for inspection;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the person who applied for the appeal inspection has not indicated the reasons for requesting the appeal inspection or has not supplied a copy of the original certificate; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the applicable fee referred to in paragraph 13(1)(g) has not been paid.

Subsection.Text: Where the Director grants an appeal inspection, the inspector carrying out the appeal inspection shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where the results of the appeal inspection substantiate the results of the original inspection, confirm the original certificate; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the results of the appeal inspection do not substantiate the results of the original inspection with respect to any factor that could not have changed since the original inspection, issue a certificate rendering the original certificate null and void.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall export out of Canada or send or convey from one province to another any maple syrup unless it is marked with a grade name and meets the requirements for that grade set out in Schedule I.
Maple syrup may be sent or conveyed from one province to another without being graded and marked as prescribed by these Regulations if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is packed in containers that have a capacity of more than 5 L; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is to be graded or reprocessed at a packing plant registered under these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: No person shall market in export trade any maple product unless it is packed and marked in accordance with Parts II and III.
Despite sections 12 and 15 and subsection (1), maple syrup or any other maple product that is not marked as prescribed by these Regulations may be marketed in export trade if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the registration number issued to the operator of the packing establishment, to the sugar bush operator or to the maple syrup shipper is marked on the label of the container or appears on the bill of lading or contract of sale; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the label or other markings on the container do not misrepresent the quality, quantity, composition, characteristics, safety or value of the maple syrup or maple product.

Subsection.Text: A person who wishes to obtain an export certificate for a maple product that certifies that the product meets the requirements of these Regulations shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: submit an application, in a form provided by the Agency, duly completed in duplicate, to an inspector or at the nearest inspection office, containing the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date and place of the application,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration number of the establishment in which the maple product was prepared,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the exporter,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the consignee,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the carrier,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the date the shipment is to go forward,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the maple product and any identification marks, including the grade and colour class claimed and the brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of shipping containers and the size, number and kind of containers per shipping container,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement that the maple product mentioned in the application is sound, wholesome and edible and that it meets the requirements of the Act and these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: the signature of the applicant, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: whether or not a block inspection is requested;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: have the product inspected by an inspector; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: pay the applicable fee prescribed by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency Fees Notice, in accordance with the conditions of payment set out in that Notice.

Subsection.Text: An inspector may carry out a block inspection if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the maple product is prepackaged;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the individual lots that make up a block of that maple product are easily identifiable; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the total net quantity of maple product in the block does not exceed 40,000 kg.

Section.Text: No person shall convey from one province to another any maple product for which standards are set out in Schedule II unless it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: complies with those standards; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is packed and marked in accordance with Part II and Part III.

Subsection.Text: This Part does not apply in respect of a shipment of maple products that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of maple syrup, does not exceed 100 L;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of maple products other than maple syrup, weighs 25 kg or less;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is part of an immigrant’s effects;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is carried on any vessel, train, motor vehicle, aircraft or other means of transportation for use as food for the crew or passengers thereof;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: is consigned to a national or international exhibition, weighs 100 kg or less, and is not intended for sale in Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: is imported from the United States onto the Akwesasne Reserve for use by an Akwesasne resident.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph (1)(f) does not apply in respect of a maple product shipped to Canada from another country through the United States, where the shipment is bonded.
For the purpose of paragraph (1)(f), Akwesasne resident means any individual who has established permanent residence on the Akwesasne Reserve.
Only maple syrup meeting the following requirements may be imported into Canada:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its container is marked with one of the grade names “Grade A” or “Processing Grade” on the same panel of the label as the name of the product and in letters of a size set out in Schedule IV;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of “Grade A” maple syrup, its container is marked, in English and French, with the name of the colour class that would have been applicable if it had been graded as “Canada Grade A”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of “Grade A” maple syrup, the percentage of light transmission of the maple syrup is as required by Schedule III for the colour class with which it is marked;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it is packed in the manner set out in section 10; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its container bears a label marked with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the words “maple syrup”,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the net quantity expressed in litres or, if less than a litre, in millilitres,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the packer or importer,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the country of origin, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the lot number or the production code.

Subsection.Text: Only a maple product, other than maple syrup, meeting the following requirements may be imported into Canada:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it complies with one of the standards set out in Schedule II;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is packed in the manner set out in section 10; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its container bears a label marked with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the maple product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the net quantity expressed in kilograms or, if less than a kilogram, in grams,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the packer or importer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the country of origin.

Subsection.Text: Maple syrup or a maple product other than maple syrup that is packed in a container that has a capacity exceeding 5 L or 5 kg, respectively, need not meet the requirements of subsections (1) or (2) to be imported into Canada if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before entry into Canada, written authorization is obtained from the President of the Agency in respect of the shipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on entry into Canada, the shipment is subjected to any inspection or analysis that under these Regulations is necessary to determine whether the product otherwise complies with these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Where an inspector seizes and detains any maple product or other thing pursuant to section 23 of the Act, the inspector shall affix to the maple product, to its container or to the other thing a detention tag on which the following are clearly marked:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the words “UNDER DETENTION” and “RETENU”, in bold-face letters;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an identification number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the maple product or other thing;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the reason for the seizure and detention;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the seizure and detention; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the inspector, in block letters, and the signature of the inspector.

Subsection.Text: No person shall alter, deface or remove a detention tag affixed to a maple product, to its container or to any other thing unless the person is authorized to do so by an inspector.
An inspector shall, after detaining any maple product or other thing in accordance with subsection 20(1), forthwith deliver or mail a notice of detention

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to the person having the care or custody of the maple product or other thing at the place where it was seized;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to the owner of the maple product or other thing that was seized, or to the owner’s agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where the maple product or other thing is removed from the place where it was seized to another place in accordance with subsection 19(5) or 25(1) of the Act, to the person having the care or custody of the maple product or other thing at that other place.

Subsection.Text: A notice of detention referred to in subsection (1) shall state that the maple product or other thing was seized and detained pursuant to section 23 of the Act and shall set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the detention tag identification number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the maple product or other thing;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the reason for the seizure and detention;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the seizure and detention;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the inspector, in block letters, and the signature of the inspector;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the place of detention; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the telephone number to call for further information in respect of the seizure and detention.

Section.Text: Any maple product or other thing detained under section 23 of the Act shall be detained under storage conditions appropriate to the preservation of the maple product or other thing.

Where an inspector determines that any detained maple product or other detained thing meets the requirements of the Act and these Regulations, the inspector shall release the maple product or other thing and shall deliver or mail one copy of a notice of release to each of the persons to whom a copy of the notice of detention referred to in subsection 21(1) was delivered or mailed.

Subsection.Text: A maple product or other thing forfeited under subsection 28(1) of the Act shall be disposed of in the manner ordered by the court directing the forfeiture and, if no order for the disposition of the maple product or other thing is made by that court, the maple product or other thing shall be disposed of in the following manner:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a maple product that is edible, it shall be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sold and any proceeds deposited to the credit of the Receiver General, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: donated to a charitable institution;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a maple product that is inedible, it shall be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sold for preparation as animal food or as a non-food product and any proceeds deposited to the credit of the Receiver General, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: disposed of or destroyed in a manner consistent with all applicable environmental requirements; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a thing other than a maple product, it shall be sold and any proceeds deposited to the credit of the Receiver General.

Subsection.Text: Any maple product or thing forfeited under subsection 28(2) of the Act shall be disposed of in the manner set out in subsection (1).

Section.Text: Maple products that are forfeited under subsection 30(2) of the Act shall be disposed of in the following manner:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a maple product that is edible, it shall be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sold and the proceeds deposited to the credit of the Receiver General, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: donated to a charitable institution; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a maple product that is inedible, it shall be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sold for preparation as animal food or as a non-food product and the proceeds deposited to the credit of the Receiver General, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: disposed of or destroyed in a manner consistent with all applicable environmental requirements.

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE I
ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Grade Name Requirements for Maple Syrup

Section.Text: Maple syrup may be graded as “Canada Grade A” if, in addition to meeting the requirements set out in section 5 of these Regulations,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is free from fermentation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is uniform in colour and free from sediment and free from any cloudiness or turbidity;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its colour class is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Golden, Delicate Taste,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Amber, Rich Taste,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: Dark, Robust Taste, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: Very Dark, Strong Taste; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it has a maple flavour characteristic of its colour class and is free from any objectionable odour or taste.

Section.Text: Maple syrup, other than that graded as “Canada Grade A”, may be graded as “Canada Processing Grade” if it meets the requirements set out in section 5 of these Regulations.

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE II
ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Standards for Maple Products Other than Maple Syrup

Section.Text: Maple sugar, soft maple sugar, maple butter, maple taffy or any other maple product except maple syrup shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: consist entirely of the product obtained directly or indirectly from maple sap;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be clean and free from objectionable flavours;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be free from any defect or deterioration affecting its edibility, appearance or shipping quality;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: have a characteristic maple flavour; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: subject to section 2, contain not more than 10 per cent moisture.

Section.Text: Paragraph 1(f) applies only to maple sugar.

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE III
ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Colour Classes of “Canada Grade A” Maple Syrup

Section.Text: The determination of the light transmission of “Canada Grade A” maple syrup shall be made optically by means of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a spectrophotometer using matched square optical cells having a 10 mm light path at a wavelength of 560 nm, the colour values being expressed in per cent of light transmission as compared to A.R. Glycerol fixed at 100 per cent transmission; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a visual glass comparator, the optical specifications of which correspond as closely as possible to the method described in paragraph (a).

Section.Text: “Canada Grade A” maple syrup shall be regarded as in a colour class set out in Column I of the table if its percentage of light transmission is that set out in Column II.

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE V
ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Method of Determining Fluid Net Contents of Containers of Maple Syrup

Section.Text: Ten containers of the same product shall be taken directly from the packer or wholesaler and the containers shall all be of the same size or declared net contents and selected to represent as many lots or batches of that product as possible.
Examine the containers and discard any container that is suspected of leaking.
Measure the entire fluid contents of each container at 20 degrees Celsius using metric graduated cylinders which cylinders shall be clean and dry for each measurement.
Express the results in millilitres or fluid ounces depending on whether the quantity declared on the label of the container is expressed in imperial or metric measure.
The lot shall be considered acceptable only if the average net contents of the 10 containers as measured equals or exceeds the declared net contents.

Subsection.Text: Nothing in these Regulations prohibits the marketing of maple products in accordance with the Maple Products Regulations, as they read immediately before the day on which these Regulations come into force.
This section ceases to have effect two years after the day on which these Regulations come into force.
